snippet: “The collapse of Iraq would bring an international oil crisis,” an expert says, but so far the oil markets are taking the growing unrest in stride.
abstract: Military offensive in Iraq by extremist insurgents is jeopardizing progress country has made as critical source of oil that helped ease world price despite tightening restrictions on Iran and tanking exports from Libya; stakes for oil markets are high as Iraqi government tries to gain control over situation.
lead_paragraph: “The collapse of Iraq would bring an international oil crisis,” an expert says, but so far the oil markets are taking the growing unrest in stride.

headline.main: Oil Industry in Iraq Faces Setback to Revival
headline.print_headline: Oil Industry in Iraq Faces Setback to Revival

keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
